strings.Value: "Are you a chieftain?"
"What's your chieftain known for?"
"I didn't know there were half-orcs among the Numerian barbarians."
"What are you doing here?"
"Do you know anything about the situation at Varnhold?"
"Have you found anything of interest?"
"Where might I find Dugath and these Sisters?"
"Tell me about Numeria."
[Stay the night] "Thank you for the invitation. I'll take you up on it."
[Attack] "I don't like the looks of you — I think you're bandits, or spies!"
"I have to go."
"The spriggans who lived in this cave are under my protection. Please leave so they can return to their home."
"Ha ha ha! Got you! I was just joking!"
"I've no time for games. Leave now, while I'm still in the mood to ask politely."
"I'm quite sane. Please try to understand — when you ousted the spriggans, you created a serious political issue that I need to resolve."
"The spriggans will return soon, and they won't be alone. They're bringing trolls, cyclopes, and giants with them. I can negotiate a peaceful solution, but only if this cave is empty!"
"All right. But if the spriggans attack you again, don't expect any help from me."
[Attack] "Then I'll just have to force you out."
"Who are these Sisters?"

{n}A half-orc woman sits by the fire. Her clothes are made of leather and fur, matching the rest of the barbarians. She frowns as she slides her finger along a map, crudely drawn on a crumpled sheet of paper. She lifts her gaze as she notices you.{/n} "Huh, guests. Who're you? If you're a friend, take a seat by the fire and let's talk. I'm Bolga, from the {g|Tiger Lords}Tiger Lords{/g} tribe. I lead this group."

"Me? No, no. Just seasoned enough to lead a group. Our chieftain is Armag the Twice-Born!" {n}Bolga says the name proudly, as though expecting recognition or awe.{/n} "He's back home in {g|Numeria}Numeria{/g} right now."

"Long ago, he was the greatest of the {g|Numeria}Numerian{/g} chieftains, and {g|Gorum}Gorum's{/g} chosen! Armag was so strong, no mortal could strike him down. It was only when {g|Pharasma}Pharasma{/g} herself challenged him to battle that he fell, and only because of her divine power. But now, Armag shamed her and came back from the afterlife! Great Armag leads the {g|Tiger Lords}Tiger Lords{/g} once more, now as Armag the Twice-Born — and soon, word of our exploits will spread all over {g|Avistan}Avistan{/g}!"
{n}The barbarian shrugs.{/n} "The orcs have lands nearby. A lot can happen between two neighboring peoples."
"I'm sure you understand as well as I do."

"We're looking for some ruins, or a cave, or something... I don't really know — only Dugath knows exactly what we're looking for. He's a cleric, and he's our leader on this expedition. Well, him and the Sisters."
"{g|Varnhold}Varnhold{/g}? Where's that?" {n}The barbarian looks down at her map and finds a rough sketch of the area.{/n} "Hmm, no. No idea. We've never been there."

"It'd be nice if we had! So far it's just dirt, crap, and monsters. Like we don't get enough of that back in {g|Numeria}Numeria{/g}! We found this hole, and the monsters that were living here — we took a beating doing it, but we managed to kick them out. Then, after we searched the place, we found out it's just a regular cave, nothing of note. After a day or so, we'll probably head out and keep searching."

"They're in our main camp, here." {n}Bolga points at a cross on her map.{/n} "If you're looking to hire us or have some other business, come visit. It'd be much better than digging around in the dirt out here."

"{g|Numeria}Numeria{/g} is the land with adamantine in its soil, and its people have adamantine in their hearts." {n}The barbarian starts solemnly, then her tone shifts.{/n} "And since we have bugger all beyond adamantine and courage, we just trade what we've got!" {n}She laughs.{/n}
{n}Bolga raises her gaze from the map.{/n} "You again? You need something?"
{n}The barbarian's jaw drops in surprise.{/n} "Wha-what? Those ugly things? Are you crazy?"
{n}Bolga slaps your shoulder, laughing loudly.{/n} "Good one! You had me going!"
{n}The barbarian shrugs.{/n} "Well, sounds odd, but all right. We weren't planning on staying long anyway. Pack up, everyone! We're leaving!"
"Sounds like your problem to deal with. No way we're leaving here after dusk."
"That so? Sounds to me like you're just spinning tales in the hopes of snatching something from us while we pack up!"
"Damn!" {n}Bolga leaps to her feet.{/n} "Thanks for the warning. Listen up, everyone! Alarm! Pack up — now!"
{n}The barbarian stares into your eyes, but she's the first to drop her gaze.{/n} "Fine... Have it your way."
{n}The half-orc grins and bares her weapons.{/n} "Well, let's see how you ask rudely!"
"Ha! Let them try. We thinned their ranks plenty already — we'll just have to finish what we started!"

"They're witches who serve Armag. They seem to know a lot about the world — history, gods, even other worlds... They're pretty smart talkers — you'd hardly believe the things they know! And they have these strange, unimaginable spells... When Armag ordered us to pack up for this expedition, we thought we'd be marching for a month. But they just waved their hands — whoosh! — a tunnel of multicolored lights opened before us. The trip here took us just one hour! Can you imagine it? I wouldn't be surprised if you can't."
"Sure, no point in denting our asses in this hole. We'll head out soon, most like. Safe journey to you!"
"I would ask you the same."
"A tunnel of many colors... Doesn't that sound familiar? Because it sure sounds familiar to me!"
"Sure... Lots of things." {n}Regongar spits on the ground.{/n}
"Oh, really? Let's see you try!"
{n}When Bolga's gaze stops on Nok-Nok, she chuckles.{/n} "Quite a beast you got there. Ones like that, we use for rags back home — their hides aren't good for anything else."
"Ones like you, I use for chowder! Meat like dung, not good for nothing else." {n}Nok-Nok glares at the sturdy woman with a predatory look as he runs a finger along the edge of his blade.{/n}
"Sure."
